Donald Rumsfeld 's account highlights how high-profile security cooperation complicated US-Uzbek relations, said Sean Roberts , an international relations professor at George Washington University. Prior to 9/11, George Washington was able to engage the country's civil society and scant independent media with modest resources in order to promote long-term opening up in the country, Sean Roberts said.`` Once the Defense Department raised the level of engagement on security issues, this inevitably forced the issue George Washington taking a more forthright stance on human rights issues as well.
